channel.title: [INFORMATIVE]Database Leak?[INFORMATIVE]
channel.description:
Well, it has come to my attention that there are multiple databases of forums with users, ip, pass and email released, and that has come to my attention that there is a chance that we MAY be next, so just a quick heads up, change your pass thats not related to anything else, that means financial, emails, and especially, runescape accounts, and I believe the database was stolen once, but I don't think I've seen a database of it released or leaked, or to be used for runescape accounts (Did a quick google search), but the next time if they manage to do it, they might just be going for your passwords for runescape.
[quote="The Outsider"]Remove your rich accounts from the RuneScape stickies then otherwise you'll be prime targets.[/quote]
And just keep in note that some people have billions posted there, so I'd suggest either removing them or replacing them with another account Just a informative heads up, NOT TO HELP OTHERS RECOVER ACCOUNTS BUT TO HELP PEOPLE PROTECT THEM

item.title: [INFORMATIVE]Database Leak?[INFORMATIVE]
item.dc:creator: @the_elve_age the elve age
item.description:
@the_elve_age wrote:

[quote=“t4, post:66, topic:424312”][quote author=the elve age link=topic=526965.msg3842349#msg3842349 date=1323352918]

[quote author=t4 link=topic=526965.msg3842099#msg3842099 date=1323314755]

[quote author=the elve age link=topic=526965.msg3842038#msg3842038 date=1323310674]

As I stated, MOST of them can be cracked in a RS database (as it was what were talking about). Wordlists can easily reach up to <80GB, but yeah you already know that

You mean RS account? I doubt he uses the same password there as here (or at least I’d be surprised if he did)

Otherwise I don’t see why you’d want his Moparscape account lol
[/quote]A lot of previous passwords on Runescape are passwords used for forums, but if anyone is smart, use different passwords.

What the fuck is a ‘RS database’? A word list - do you mean a DICTIONARY with the computed hashes? If so, chances are an individual is not going to use a single word for his password.

For SMF, the password hashing algorithm is currently: sha1(strtolower($username) . $password) - thus, the a hash of t4secretpassword123; so, unless your ‘word list’ has generated my username (to lowercase) then my password concatenated, you’re going to have a pretty rough time.

The time complexity assuming a 6 character username (lowercase) and 8 character password is now:

Username: 42^6 = 5489031744
Password: 68^8 = 4.571632397×10¹⁴

Concatenated: 2.509383535×10²⁴

So that would mean for a dictionary to be complete with all username that are 6 characters and have 8 character long passwords, it would have to contain 2.509383535×10²⁴ entries. Assuming you’re generating this dictionary at 1,000 hashes per second, you’re left with 2.509383535×10²¹ seconds (795,720,299,000,000 years / 795.72 trillion years).

So, this is easy, huh?
[/quote]Stop being so damn argumentative, I’m not trying to fucking argue about it. I said most words can be cracked. Anyone can use a sentence, phrase, interesting word mix up and be fine; an “RS database” is a compilation of hacked emails, salts, hashes from older Runescape forums, the passwords aren’t unique due to a younger audience Runescape attracts therefore bring a smaller word deficit.

Who do you know that has a single word as a password, though (especially a wealthy one)?
[/quote]Lets see. Example, 9f7d8e74fdec2f31e96d67378bbf2b61:NSE:jackyy a7676f37e05628a5c2208e087f3650eb:v;*:greenguy fbd4b3be7758e71e7e02e6385d4272a8:&HF:jacko10 7ddf4753074551f5cdd51e9d53aa16bf:];.:greendays 10a4fd1c35fa58a0870e63068c2bd408:cIN:bibigun 9faef5a3e8020aef9ba74e1c40f9f547:Prh:greendayfan fe98bd083601d4c412a857b36c09b392:G:4:snake11 575c8161782e3df2ad44547d422ed0aa:tR3:santy25 6a27329b28b0f5a0c807d5a7f6fd9bdd:S0+:2dum2live 63e626ce62862960f0ec14f2e8074170:73O:raper 09e6c1ee223f8309855ae0758a2b23f8:IDa:jack1996 b1878b0011909c11971f65e099ffa3fa:D1K:qwerty99 5e00c5f7c2b21c128084782414fcc166:/J5:tcwhite bccfb90ec7f672d1e161012542c5dd01:I7q:qwertyqwerty 2f2da08f71d018b9a02df91b5da5720d:5 Q:extreem 703f277f568e1f42370311d6ade8ff19:4(1:quick1 ef9152d52cac1387d60d6a83e353483d:}nb:jeroen123 1b681b4ce092c5c583b5b73d1a9d72af:?,$:skyler123 931bace7e8320a6f63bdd165b7c26c1f:4|r:yah 85cf7cdc49f7ae80a4adbc78f97993ee:,QD:yah 24b2c923e5869cb15135d53f5737de88:B!P:poopsy 44a1baa8002dc936c01c96792f52c563:i[4:iwonttell e2b7563859f4f4ab6ca1fac341cba32c:i+T:skilla 3a063b8faefe1c2e91315241689a647e:-r{:pollys 4ba0fa61859d59e467a90ae7303c10d8:ifZ:sjors 854f661af3de6e3b6e644508210457be:~{e:number86 645bc5a401846459d1d775a35a75d517:.jE:pimpmaster 148304d7dc2a26d4aa2af4e6007213b4:_J2:piggy7 5a65ec344426966d3178ef280159963f:udS:italia06 58422f349f3fc256cc06c5837f57c65d:ew~:simone11 f91f1cebc5c4105efa1fd138014a8ac4:Z&k:pickle123 16743b6af8ea9a36104a5aa0397293f6:>Q&:pierce1 476dc32f86da422bd554d9e24ba8124f:k^n:greatmaster 602b07a60d5017d12242e0245ce36076:AXn:coolnerd 854cb9593ce812d29f587a7b1c0d21b9:jIQ:isis 2a5719a595dcc734fcb1dc995edc6c22:gXe:pedro12 8d34476b789606d6b5f2852dc2dcd5e1:6{8:coolman99 b7219f6fd0e9b45bb5520c677be21f89:.~l:paul15 181fdf36d6a2ca6e756b049af7927d3c:B7w:sigmar 5c6d8d630d8efed2d3e1abe2e3740460:l1;:yaali 8c23df484e2ae7caafa98ac095ca97ce:2af:jente 6d8957fdb181288d6359ffb7d1c04fb3:9)#:jente fd54bb4a833735cbadcd691f61be3822:$I{:jensen123

most of those aren’t words, most likely a collection of passwords used by others.[/quote]Touche

Read full topic

item.title: [INFORMATIVE]Database Leak?[INFORMATIVE]
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“the elve age, post:62, topic:424312”][quote author=t4 link=topic=526965.msg3842099#msg3842099 date=1323314755]

[quote author=the elve age link=topic=526965.msg3842038#msg3842038 date=1323310674]

[quote author=t4 link=topic=526965.msg3841725#msg3841725 date=1323297815]

As I stated, MOST of them can be cracked in a RS database (as it was what were talking about). Wordlists can easily reach up to <80GB, but yeah you already know that

You mean RS account? I doubt he uses the same password there as here (or at least I’d be surprised if he did)

Otherwise I don’t see why you’d want his Moparscape account lol
[/quote]A lot of previous passwords on Runescape are passwords used for forums, but if anyone is smart, use different passwords.

What the fuck is a ‘RS database’? A word list - do you mean a DICTIONARY with the computed hashes? If so, chances are an individual is not going to use a single word for his password.

For SMF, the password hashing algorithm is currently: sha1(strtolower($username) . $password) - thus, the a hash of t4secretpassword123; so, unless your ‘word list’ has generated my username (to lowercase) then my password concatenated, you’re going to have a pretty rough time.

The time complexity assuming a 6 character username (lowercase) and 8 character password is now:

Username: 42^6 = 5489031744
Password: 68^8 = 4.571632397×10¹⁴

Concatenated: 2.509383535×10²⁴

So that would mean for a dictionary to be complete with all username that are 6 characters and have 8 character long passwords, it would have to contain 2.509383535×10²⁴ entries. Assuming you’re generating this dictionary at 1,000 hashes per second, you’re left with 2.509383535×10²¹ seconds (795,720,299,000,000 years / 795.72 trillion years).

So, this is easy, huh?
[/quote]Stop being so damn argumentative, I’m not trying to fucking argue about it. I said most words can be cracked. Anyone can use a sentence, phrase, interesting word mix up and be fine; an “RS database” is a compilation of hacked emails, salts, hashes from older Runescape forums, the passwords aren’t unique due to a younger audience Runescape attracts therefore bring a smaller word deficit.

Who do you know that has a single word as a password, though (especially a wealthy one)?
[/quote]Lets see. Example, 9f7d8e74fdec2f31e96d67378bbf2b61:NSE:jackyy a7676f37e05628a5c2208e087f3650eb:v;*:greenguy fbd4b3be7758e71e7e02e6385d4272a8:&HF:jacko10 7ddf4753074551f5cdd51e9d53aa16bf:];.:greendays 10a4fd1c35fa58a0870e63068c2bd408:cIN:bibigun 9faef5a3e8020aef9ba74e1c40f9f547:Prh:greendayfan fe98bd083601d4c412a857b36c09b392:G:4:snake11 575c8161782e3df2ad44547d422ed0aa:tR3:santy25 6a27329b28b0f5a0c807d5a7f6fd9bdd:S0+:2dum2live 63e626ce62862960f0ec14f2e8074170:73O:raper 09e6c1ee223f8309855ae0758a2b23f8:IDa:jack1996 b1878b0011909c11971f65e099ffa3fa:D1K:qwerty99 5e00c5f7c2b21c128084782414fcc166:/J5:tcwhite bccfb90ec7f672d1e161012542c5dd01:I7q:qwertyqwerty 2f2da08f71d018b9a02df91b5da5720d:5 Q:extreem 703f277f568e1f42370311d6ade8ff19:4(1:quick1 ef9152d52cac1387d60d6a83e353483d:}nb:jeroen123 1b681b4ce092c5c583b5b73d1a9d72af:?,$:skyler123 931bace7e8320a6f63bdd165b7c26c1f:4|r:yah 85cf7cdc49f7ae80a4adbc78f97993ee:,QD:yah 24b2c923e5869cb15135d53f5737de88:B!P:poopsy 44a1baa8002dc936c01c96792f52c563:i[4:iwonttell e2b7563859f4f4ab6ca1fac341cba32c:i+T:skilla 3a063b8faefe1c2e91315241689a647e:-r{:pollys 4ba0fa61859d59e467a90ae7303c10d8:ifZ:sjors 854f661af3de6e3b6e644508210457be:~{e:number86 645bc5a401846459d1d775a35a75d517:.jE:pimpmaster 148304d7dc2a26d4aa2af4e6007213b4:_J2:piggy7 5a65ec344426966d3178ef280159963f:udS:italia06 58422f349f3fc256cc06c5837f57c65d:ew~:simone11 f91f1cebc5c4105efa1fd138014a8ac4:Z&k:pickle123 16743b6af8ea9a36104a5aa0397293f6:>Q&:pierce1 476dc32f86da422bd554d9e24ba8124f:k^n:greatmaster 602b07a60d5017d12242e0245ce36076:AXn:coolnerd 854cb9593ce812d29f587a7b1c0d21b9:jIQ:isis 2a5719a595dcc734fcb1dc995edc6c22:gXe:pedro12 8d34476b789606d6b5f2852dc2dcd5e1:6{8:coolman99 b7219f6fd0e9b45bb5520c677be21f89:.~l:paul15 181fdf36d6a2ca6e756b049af7927d3c:B7w:sigmar 5c6d8d630d8efed2d3e1abe2e3740460:l1;:yaali 8c23df484e2ae7caafa98ac095ca97ce:2af:jente 6d8957fdb181288d6359ffb7d1c04fb3:9)#:jente fd54bb4a833735cbadcd691f61be3822:$I{:jensen123[/quote]
most of those aren’t words, most likely a collection of passwords used by others.

Read full topic

item.title: [INFORMATIVE]Database Leak?[INFORMATIVE]
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote="-Nothing, post:64, topic:424312"][quote author=shrogg link=topic=526965.msg3842260#msg3842260 date=1323332281]
Its amazing how fast generating hash tables is with 2 GPU’s at 100%, although they become very hot, very quickly
[/quote]
Since when have you generated hash tables with Graphical Processing Unit?[/quote]

GPUs are often used in conjunction with CPUs to asynchronously fill hash tables. The more processing units you use, the faster it goes (since you get more done per unit of time).

Read full topic

item.title: [INFORMATIVE]Database Leak?[INFORMATIVE]
item.dc:creator: @the_elve_age the elve age
item.description:
@the_elve_age wrote:

[quote=“t4, post:46, topic:424312”][quote author=the elve age link=topic=526965.msg3842038#msg3842038 date=1323310674]

[quote author=t4 link=topic=526965.msg3841725#msg3841725 date=1323297815]

As I stated, MOST of them can be cracked in a RS database (as it was what were talking about). Wordlists can easily reach up to <80GB, but yeah you already know that

You mean RS account? I doubt he uses the same password there as here (or at least I’d be surprised if he did)

Otherwise I don’t see why you’d want his Moparscape account lol
[/quote]A lot of previous passwords on Runescape are passwords used for forums, but if anyone is smart, use different passwords.

What the fuck is a ‘RS database’? A word list - do you mean a DICTIONARY with the computed hashes? If so, chances are an individual is not going to use a single word for his password.

For SMF, the password hashing algorithm is currently: sha1(strtolower($username) . $password) - thus, the a hash of t4secretpassword123; so, unless your ‘word list’ has generated my username (to lowercase) then my password concatenated, you’re going to have a pretty rough time.

The time complexity assuming a 6 character username (lowercase) and 8 character password is now:

Username: 42^6 = 5489031744
Password: 68^8 = 4.571632397×10¹⁴

Concatenated: 2.509383535×10²⁴

So that would mean for a dictionary to be complete with all username that are 6 characters and have 8 character long passwords, it would have to contain 2.509383535×10²⁴ entries. Assuming you’re generating this dictionary at 1,000 hashes per second, you’re left with 2.509383535×10²¹ seconds (795,720,299,000,000 years / 795.72 trillion years).

So, this is easy, huh?
[/quote]Stop being so damn argumentative, I’m not trying to fucking argue about it. I said most words can be cracked. Anyone can use a sentence, phrase, interesting word mix up and be fine; an “RS database” is a compilation of hacked emails, salts, hashes from older Runescape forums, the passwords aren’t unique due to a younger audience Runescape attracts therefore bring a smaller word deficit.

Who do you know that has a single word as a password, though (especially a wealthy one)?[/quote]Lets see. Example, 9f7d8e74fdec2f31e96d67378bbf2b61:NSE:jackyy a7676f37e05628a5c2208e087f3650eb:v;*:greenguy fbd4b3be7758e71e7e02e6385d4272a8:&HF:jacko10 7ddf4753074551f5cdd51e9d53aa16bf:];.:greendays 10a4fd1c35fa58a0870e63068c2bd408:cIN:bibigun 9faef5a3e8020aef9ba74e1c40f9f547:Prh:greendayfan fe98bd083601d4c412a857b36c09b392:G:4:snake11 575c8161782e3df2ad44547d422ed0aa:tR3:santy25 6a27329b28b0f5a0c807d5a7f6fd9bdd:S0+:2dum2live 63e626ce62862960f0ec14f2e8074170:73O:raper 09e6c1ee223f8309855ae0758a2b23f8:IDa:jack1996 b1878b0011909c11971f65e099ffa3fa:D1K:qwerty99 5e00c5f7c2b21c128084782414fcc166:/J5:tcwhite bccfb90ec7f672d1e161012542c5dd01:I7q:qwertyqwerty 2f2da08f71d018b9a02df91b5da5720d:5 Q:extreem 703f277f568e1f42370311d6ade8ff19:4(1:quick1 ef9152d52cac1387d60d6a83e353483d:}nb:jeroen123 1b681b4ce092c5c583b5b73d1a9d72af:?,$:skyler123 931bace7e8320a6f63bdd165b7c26c1f:4|r:yah 85cf7cdc49f7ae80a4adbc78f97993ee:,QD:yah 24b2c923e5869cb15135d53f5737de88:B!P:poopsy 44a1baa8002dc936c01c96792f52c563:i[4:iwonttell e2b7563859f4f4ab6ca1fac341cba32c:i+T:skilla 3a063b8faefe1c2e91315241689a647e:-r{:pollys 4ba0fa61859d59e467a90ae7303c10d8:ifZ:sjors 854f661af3de6e3b6e644508210457be:~{e:number86 645bc5a401846459d1d775a35a75d517:.jE:pimpmaster 148304d7dc2a26d4aa2af4e6007213b4:_J2:piggy7 5a65ec344426966d3178ef280159963f:udS:italia06 58422f349f3fc256cc06c5837f57c65d:ew~:simone11 f91f1cebc5c4105efa1fd138014a8ac4:Z&k:pickle123 16743b6af8ea9a36104a5aa0397293f6:>Q&:pierce1 476dc32f86da422bd554d9e24ba8124f:k^n:greatmaster 602b07a60d5017d12242e0245ce36076:AXn:coolnerd 854cb9593ce812d29f587a7b1c0d21b9:jIQ:isis 2a5719a595dcc734fcb1dc995edc6c22:gXe:pedro12 8d34476b789606d6b5f2852dc2dcd5e1:6{8:coolman99 b7219f6fd0e9b45bb5520c677be21f89:.~l:paul15 181fdf36d6a2ca6e756b049af7927d3c:B7w:sigmar 5c6d8d630d8efed2d3e1abe2e3740460:l1;:yaali 8c23df484e2ae7caafa98ac095ca97ce:2af:jente 6d8957fdb181288d6359ffb7d1c04fb3:9)#:jente fd54bb4a833735cbadcd691f61be3822:$I{:jensen123

item.title: [INFORMATIVE]Database Leak?[INFORMATIVE]
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“Andrew Ferguson, post:58, topic:424312”][quote author=shrogg link=topic=526965.msg3842239#msg3842239 date=1323329712]
What if my pc does it at an average of 18,000 passwords/second? + GPU = around 30,000/s?
[/quote]
It’s often not the computer that matters, more of the server and the site, there is a limit to how much data a site can take in so fast.[/quote]What? What are you talking about… we’re talking about generating hash tables (or at least comparing hashes), not submitting log in information for each attempt, that would be along the lines of 10 per second…

Read full topic

item.title: [INFORMATIVE]Database Leak?[INFORMATIVE]
item.dc:creator: @Andrew_Ferguson The317Guy
item.description:
@Andrew_Ferguson wrote:

shrogg:

What if my pc does it at an average of 18,000 passwords/second? + GPU = around 30,000/s?

It’s often not the computer that matters, more of the server and the site, there is a limit to how much data a site can take in so fast.

Read full topic

item.title: [INFORMATIVE]Database Leak?[INFORMATIVE]
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:55, topic:424312”]I added that before you posted :o

And the only reason I mentioned single words is because you said: “We’re talking about single words, things in the English dictionary - no substitutions, trailing numbers, etc.”[/quote]
fair enough, but there’s only certain instances where a dictionary attack actually is feasible.

Read full topic

item.title: [INFORMATIVE]Database Leak?[INFORMATIVE]
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

I added that before you posted :o

And the only reason I mentioned single words is because you said: “We’re talking about single words, things in the English dictionary - no substitutions, trailing numbers, etc.”

Read full topic

item.title: [INFORMATIVE]Database Leak?[INFORMATIVE]
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:53, topic:424312”][quote author=t4 link=topic=526965.msg3842171#msg3842171 date=1323318769]

[quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=526965.msg3842109#msg3842109 date=1323315712]

Tbh all my passes are single word, but they atleast contain multiple numbers. Something like this.
0nom4t0p0314, onomatopoeia

We’re talking about single words, things in the English dictionary - no substitutions, trailing numbers, etc.
[/quote]In that case your numbers are extremely inaccurate, because knowing where the salt(username) is in the hash, all you need to do is try out every word in the English language, not every permutation

I don’t think I posted any calculations that had to do with salts at all?
EDIT: nope, I did not.
[/quote]Errr… the username is the salt in what you posted, hence the word ‘username’ in parenthesis Either way, it doesn’t take away the fact that a simple dictionary attack (meaning you use the words that are in the language) is MUCH faster than just generating your own via every permutation and comparing it to that.

And even if they do have some trailing numbers, a standard dictionary attack has that as well. And these could be cracked in weeks, maybe even days with a standard dictionary attack.[/quote]
Ah, but I did take out the username in the last calculation as I knew you’d point that out!

As for a dictionary attack, it would only work if their password was just a word in the dictionary. Trailing numbers will completely change the hash. Your only hope then is if the dictionary also contained all words in the English dictionary with a string of numbers at the end.

Assuming up to 4 numbers are appended to the end of a password where the password is a word in the English dictionary:

  • 171,476 total words in the English language (according to Oxford)
  • 10^4 + 10^3 + 10^2 + 10^1 = 11,110 (possibilities)

So for each word, there are 11,110 permutations.

Total words: 1,905,098,360

To generate these permutations: 22 days 1 hour.

Read full topic

item.title: [INFORMATIVE]Database Leak?[INFORMATIVE]
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“t4, post:52, topic:424312”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=526965.msg3842109#msg3842109 date=1323315712]

Tbh all my passes are single word, but they atleast contain multiple numbers. Something like this.
0nom4t0p0314, onomatopoeia

We’re talking about single words, things in the English dictionary - no substitutions, trailing numbers, etc.
[/quote]In that case your numbers are extremely inaccurate, because knowing where the salt(username) is in the hash, all you need to do is try out every word in the English language, not every permutation

I don’t think I posted any calculations that had to do with salts at all?
EDIT: nope, I did not.[/quote]Errr… the username is the salt in what you posted, hence the word ‘username’ in parenthesis Either way, it doesn’t take away the fact that a simple dictionary attack (meaning you use the words that are in the language) is MUCH faster than just generating your own via every permutation and comparing it to that.

And even if they do have some trailing numbers, a standard dictionary attack has that as well. And these could be cracked in weeks, maybe even days with a standard dictionary attack.

Based on the oxford dictionary general consensus that by one definition the English dictionary would contain around a quarter of a million words, and using your 1000 hashes per second (which is somewhat unreasonable, but still), it would take around 250 seconds to crack a password that was JUST a word from the English language, if you know the location of the salt (in this case, their username)

It’s when you include numbers, multiple words, substitutions and such that you start taking exponentially longer.

Read full topic

We’re talking about single words, things in the English dictionary - no substitutions, trailing numbers, etc.
[/quote]In that case your numbers are extremely inaccurate, because knowing where the salt(username) is in the hash, all you need to do is try out every word in the English language, not every permutation[/quote]

item.title: [INFORMATIVE]Database Leak?[INFORMATIVE]
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“the elve age, post:45, topic:424312”][quote author=t4 link=topic=526965.msg3841725#msg3841725 date=1323297815]

[quote author=the elve age link=topic=526965.msg3841605#msg3841605 date=1323292228]
As I stated, MOST of them can be cracked in a RS database (as it was what were talking about). Wordlists can easily reach up to <80GB, but yeah you already know that

You mean RS account? I doubt he uses the same password there as here (or at least I’d be surprised if he did)

Otherwise I don’t see why you’d want his Moparscape account lol
[/quote]A lot of previous passwords on Runescape are passwords used for forums, but if anyone is smart, use different passwords.

What the fuck is a ‘RS database’? A word list - do you mean a DICTIONARY with the computed hashes? If so, chances are an individual is not going to use a single word for his password.

For SMF, the password hashing algorithm is currently: sha1(strtolower($username) . $password) - thus, the a hash of t4secretpassword123; so, unless your ‘word list’ has generated my username (to lowercase) then my password concatenated, you’re going to have a pretty rough time.

The time complexity assuming a 6 character username (lowercase) and 8 character password is now:

Username: 42^6 = 5489031744
Password: 68^8 = 4.571632397×10¹⁴

Concatenated: 2.509383535×10²⁴

So that would mean for a dictionary to be complete with all username that are 6 characters and have 8 character long passwords, it would have to contain 2.509383535×10²⁴ entries. Assuming you’re generating this dictionary at 1,000 hashes per second, you’re left with 2.509383535×10²¹ seconds (795,720,299,000,000 years / 795.72 trillion years).

So, this is easy, huh?
[/quote]Stop being so damn argumentative, I’m not trying to fucking argue about it. I said most words can be cracked. Anyone can use a sentence, phrase, interesting word mix up and be fine; an “RS database” is a compilation of hacked emails, salts, hashes from older Runescape forums, the passwords aren’t unique due to a younger audience Runescape attracts therefore bring a smaller word deficit.[/quote]
Who do you know that has a single word as a password, though (especially a wealthy one)?

Read full topic

[/quote]A lot of previous passwords on Runescape are passwords used for forums, but if anyone is smart, use different passwords.

What the fuck is a ‘RS database’? A word list - do you mean a DICTIONARY with the computed hashes? If so, chances are an individual is not going to use a single word for his password.

For SMF, the password hashing algorithm is currently: sha1(strtolower($username) . $password) - thus, the a hash of t4secretpassword123; so, unless your ‘word list’ has generated my username (to lowercase) then my password concatenated, you’re going to have a pretty rough time.

The time complexity assuming a 6 character username (lowercase) and 8 character password is now:

Username: 42^6 = 5489031744
Password: 68^8 = 4.571632397×10¹⁴

Concatenated: 2.509383535×10²⁴

So that would mean for a dictionary to be complete with all username that are 6 characters and have 8 character long passwords, it would have to contain 2.509383535×10²⁴ entries. Assuming you’re generating this dictionary at 1,000 hashes per second, you’re left with 2.509383535×10²¹ seconds (795,720,299,000,000 years / 795.72 trillion years).

So, this is easy, huh?[/quote]Stop being so damn argumentative, I’m not trying to fucking argue about it. I said most words can be cracked. Anyone can use a sentence, phrase, interesting word mix up and be fine; an “RS database” is a compilation of hacked emails, salts, hashes from older Runescape forums, the passwords aren’t unique due to a younger audience Runescape attracts therefore bring a smaller word deficit.
